title: United Airlines to Review 'Worst Travel Nightmare'
summary: Passengers were grounded for 12 hours on United Airlines plane headed from Newark to Hong Kong following medical, mechanical problems. title: Facebook's WhatsApp Fights Fake News by Curbing Message Forwarding
summary: Action follows criticism that the platform was used to spread misinformation, rumors. Facebook Inc.'s WhatsApp messaging service is limiting users' ability to forward content, seeking to curtail ways the popular platform allows the spread of misinformation and sometimes has led to violence.

summary: Presidential contender and her team will be based in hip Troy. Troy bills itself as the "Home of Uncle Sam." Will that now change to Aunt Kirsten?

summary: Skin-care founder had been stripped of CEO role after erratic behavior. TORONTO-Deciem founder Brandon Truaxe, whose erratic behavior led to his being stripped of his CEO role at the popular skin-care company, died on Sunday.

title: Carlos Ghosn Offers to Pay for Ankle Monitor, Security to Get Bail in Japan
summary: The former Nissan chairman also offered to surrender his passport and live in a rented Tokyo apartment. TOKYO-Carlos Ghosn scaled back his request for bail as his detention stretches into its ninth week, promising to stay in Tokyo and pay for an ankle monitor and security guards to ensure he doesn't flee.

title: China Experts Call on Beijing to Release Detained Canadians
summary: More than 100 Western academics and former diplomats sign open letter to President Xi Jinping. BEIJING-More than 100 Western academics and former diplomats urged Beijing to release two Canadians detained last month, warning that the detentions during a diplomatic row with Canada will heighten distrust of China.

title: Venezuela Says It Foiled Military Uprising
summary: Authorities arrested 27 dissident soldiers ahead of antigovernment demonstrations planned for Wednesday. Venezuela's armed forces quelled a brief uprising at a military stockade, authorities said Monday, prompting protests in a poor Caracas enclave and heightening tensions ahead of antigovernment demonstrations planned for later this week.

title: Senate to Weigh Trump's Proposal to End Shutdown, With Passage Unlikely
summary: Impasse drags into 31st day, with another employee pay period deadline looming. WASHINGTON-The Senate this week is expected to vote on a border-security proposal put forward by President Trump that is unlikely to garner enough support to cross procedural hurdles, leaving no clear path forward as the partial government shutdown stretches into its fifth week.

title: Macron Courts Business Elite at Hallmark of France's Splendor
summary: At Versailles Palace, Davos-bound business leaders are wined, dined and urged to 'choose France'. VERSAILLES, France-French President Emmanuel Macron hosted the world's Davos-bound business elite at the Palace of Versailles on Monday in an effort to mend France's image, badly bruised by the yellow-vest protests.

title: The Shaming of Karen Pence
summary: A mob of secular Puritans targets her for teaching at a Christian school.. Will no one speak up for Karen Pence other than her husband?

title: Charles De Gaulle Saw Brexit Coming
summary: He said U.K. membership would weaken the EU and divide Britain.. The Brexit soap opera continues, with all eyes now fixed on the Irish frontier. The land border between Northern Ireland and the Irish Republic is open, but it will be difficult to keep it that way once the U.K. leaves the European Union. Late last year Theresa May's government accepted Brussels' demand for an "Irish backstop" in its Brexit plan-a commitment to introduce a customs border between Northern Ireland and the rest of the U.K. so that cross-border travel and trade would remain seamless. The unpopularity of this idea among U.K. Brexiteers is the chief reason Parliament voted down Prime Minister May's proposed Brexit agreement with the EU.

title: 'The Ravages of Capitalism'
summary: The New Yorker's ads for the rich support writers who hate the hands that feed them.. An anonymous writer, reviewing a book of poetry in the New Yorker, says the poems probe "the contradictions of desire amid the ravages of capitalism and racism." That's an odd juxtaposition. Racism is horribly destructive, but capitalism? People live longer and better thanks to free markets.

title: 'We Want to Negotiate' Review: Deal or No Deal
summary: When hostages are taken and demands are announced, is it better to negotiate with captors or to refuse to make any concessions?. In March 1973, members of the terrorist group Black September held a Belgian and two American diplomats hostage in Khartoum, Sudan, and demanded the release of various prisoners, including Sirhan Sirhan, the man convicted in Sen. Robert Kennedy's murder. A reporter asked President Nixon how he planned to respond. With the nation's memories of the late senator still fresh, Nixon couldn't appear to entertain concessions that would free the assassin. "As far as the United States as a government giving in to blackmail demands, we cannot do so and we will not do so," Nixon said. "We will do everything we can to get them released but we will not pay blackmail." The terrorists, hearing the statement hours later, promptly killed the diplomats. Nixon's no-concessions gambit, articulated for a specific political moment, has defined U.S. policy on hostages ever since.

title: The Crippling Cost of 70% Tax Rates
summary: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's proposal would smother investment and innovation, leaving America poorer.. Newly elected Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez spent her first few weeks on Capitol Hill calling for a 70% top marginal income-tax rate, and suddenly the debate over optimal rates has reopened. To support her charge, some liberals are citing a 2011 study by economists Peter Diamond and Emmanuel Saez, which advocates for confiscatory upper-range tax rates. But a quick look at their analysis reveals grave caveats that only an advocate of higher taxes could possibly overlook.

title: Kamala Harris for the Prosecution
summary: Liberals used to champion due process and the rights of the accused. These days they're more selective.. Can a prosecutor win the Democratic presidential nomination? The question appears to worry Sen. Kamala Harris, a former San Francisco district attorney and California attorney general, who announced her candidacy Monday.

title: The Women's March Follows Farrakhan off a Cliff
summary: Its leaders' anti-Semitism drives off the Democratic Party and the Southern Poverty Law Center.. Saturday's Women's March was much smaller than the original, held in 2017. It was notable not only because far fewer showed up but for who stayed away. The Democratic Party disavowed its partnership with the march, as did the Southern Poverty Law Center, Emily's List, the Human Rights Campaign, NARAL, the Center for American Progress and hundreds of other liberal interest groups. The march had 550 official partners in 2018 and less than half as many this year. One by one, the pink hats came off.

title: Pelosi's Dreamer Pawns
summary: Democrats won't talk even after Trump offers extended legal status.. Democrats rejected Donald Trump's compromise on immigration even before it was offered on Saturday, and that by itself should be instructive for the American public. Do Democrats want a deal to reopen the government and offer new security for more than a million immigrants, or do they want to use them as pawns against Mr. Trump?

title: The Xi Jinping Slowdown
summary: China's weakest growth in 30 years shows the logic of a trade deal.. The logic behind a U.S.-China trade deal grew even more persuasive with Monday's report that the Chinese economy grew by 6.6% last year, its slowest rate since 1990.

title: A Growth Debate for Germany
summary: The main center-right party's new leader weighs tax reform.. Now that Europe's economy shows signs of slowing, the question will be what to do about it. One hopeful development is that tax reform may be back on the table in Germany, the eurozone's largest and most important economy.

title: Kamala Harris Says She Is Running for President
summary: Former prosecutor joins crowded field, seeking to become second black commander in chief. WASHINGTON-California Sen. Kamala Harris said Monday she will seek the Democratic nomination for president, launching a campaign to become the nation's first woman and second African-American to win the White House.

title: Insurgents Attack Intelligence-Agency Base in Afghanistan, Killing Dozens
summary: U.S., Taliban officials meet in Qatar for another round of talks. KABUL-On a day when Taliban and U.S. officials met in the Gulf state of Qatar for another round of talks to end the Afghan war, insurgents detonated a captured Humvee loaded with explosives at the gate of a base operated by the country's intelligence agency and stormed the compound, spraying gunfire.

title: Bernie Sanders's Presidential Do-Over Hinges on Better Results in the South
summary: For 2020 candidates, emphasis on education could strengthen appeal with African-Americans, party leaders and voters say. COLUMBIA, S.C.-Sen. Bernie Sanders' insurgent 2016 presidential bid ran into a snag here after strong showings in Iowa and New Hampshire: His opponent Hillary Clinton trounced him in this early-voting state, foreshadowing the Vermont independent's weakness in areas where the Democratic base is largely made up of nonwhite voters.

title: EU Sanctions Leading Syrian Businessman
summary: Samer Foz positioned himself as an intermediary to foreign investors in Syria's reconstruction, and had said he shouldn't be sanctioned. A leading Syrian businessman, Samer Foz, was among 11 individuals and five companies the European Union sanctioned Monday for providing financial and other support to the regime of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Pinkerton Detectives Still Exist, and They're Tired of Being the Bad Guys
summary: The security agents, who gained fame as Old West law enforcers, are still around-and they're not happy about being antagonists in 'Red Dead Redemption II'. Pinkerton's National Detective Agency, formed in the 1800s to help law enforcement track down criminals, once sparred with the outlaw Jesse James. It later became entangled in the notorious labor disputes of industrial America.

title: Google Fined $57 Million in Biggest Penalty Yet Under New European Law
summary: The fine is one of the highest profile regulatory actions stemming from the European Union's new GDPR rules. A French regulator fined Alphabet Inc.'s Google €50 million ($56.8 million)-the biggest penalty so far under a new European privacy law-alleging the search-engine giant didn't go far enough getting valid user consent to gather data for targeted advertising.

title: Under U.S. Pressure, Germany Bans Iranian Airline
summary: Berlin said the move in the interests of the country's security. title: Russia Accuses Facebook, Twitter of Failing to Comply With Data Laws
summary: Social-media giants' servers for storing Russian's personal data must be located in Russia, says watchdog. summary: Apollo/RPC could announce deal Tuesday. Private-equity giant Apollo Global Management LLC is in advanced talks to acquire RPC Group PLC, one of Europe's biggest packaging companies, for more than $3.8 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: The Blue-on-Blue War for the L.A. Schools
summary: The blue-on-blue battle over teacher pay in Los Angeles is a reminder that fissures in our body politic are more complex than a simple blue-red divide.. Regarding your editorial "Unions in La-La Land" (Jan. 15) and the same-day op-ed "L.A. Schools Have a Math Problem" by Los Angeles Unified School District (LAUSD) Superintendent Austin Beutner: The blue-on-blue battle over teacher pay in Los Angeles is a reminder that fissures in our body politic are more complex than a simple blue-red divide. Regardless of which blue side "wins" the Los Angeles teachers union strike, there still will be unaffordable pension and health benefits that squeeze the school district toward bankruptcy, and there still will be a public-school system failing to give many students a decent education.

title: We Can Improve Grid Defense Against Hacks
summary: Our nation's utilities are the lifeblood of our economy and our civilization.. "Russian Hack Exposes Weakness in U.S. Power Grid" (page one, Jan. 11) illuminates the continued cybersecurity needs of the energy sector and underscores the urgency with which these vulnerabilities must be addressed. The sophistication and widespread nature of such attacks raise the question: Are we doing enough to defend our nation's critical infrastructure? The modernization of U.S. electric-utility systems and energy grids will result in exponential growth of connected devices. Advanced connectivity will add to customer convenience while improving efficiency and reliability, but it will also increase points of entry into networks, which may be targeted by cyber criminals.

title: The Never-Ending, Open-Ended Carbon Tax
summary: Americans should fear an open-ended tax that can be increased without limit and will never go away.. Mark Mills's "Have We Got a Carbon Tax 'Dividend' for You" (op-ed, Jan. 9) isn't nearly scary enough. The price of every single thing will increase with the tax: electricity, gasoline, food, clothing and anything manufactured or transported by fossil-based energy.

title: Old Techniques Can Work
summary: A physical barrier (wall) is a "third-century solution" as the wheel is a Neolithic solution.. title: Conan O'Brien Doesn't Want to Be Killing Time
summary: The comedian wants to shake up the late-night TV talk format with his sleek, revamped show on TBS. Conan O'Brien doesn't want to spill all the beans about his revamped TV show, which returns to TBS on Tuesday after being on hiatus since October. Pressed for details, the longtime late-night host reveals a little and deflects a little. The reformatted "Conan" will air Mondays through Thursdays at 11 p.m., for half an hour instead of an hour. Mr. O'Brien won't sit behind a desk and normally will have only one guest a night. Stand-up comedians will still perform regularly but not musical acts.
